content: hey guys why lock here have fun doing
the livestream the other night and congratulations to raffle winner David
bunch who will receive all five items that we crafted in that livestream if
you're unable to join us for the live stream and you don't feel like sitting
for an hour watching a real-time low res build here is a tutorial on how to make
those 5 items for an alchemist workshop right so first up we need to prepare a
bunch of wood planks normally this is where I would say go see episode seven
but it's been a while so here's a quick modernized recap standard popsicle stick
use a wood chisel screwdriver or any other hard tool to carve wavy lines base
in black over brush with burnt umber load up the brush with paint bleed off a
good amount on the palette and then strike the stick perpendicularly so that
the brushes skip over the grooves that you just carved then with a burnt orange
like terracotta dry brush and then finally with a honey brown dry brush
again but sporadically leaving a few spots untouched the end result is this
deep rich worn looking wood plank first up is a shelf of potions chopped
five planks at two inches long you should get two planks per popsicle stick
lay them out together side by side I use them on some packing tape to help keep
them together and then cut another two inch long plank and hot glue it along
one edge and then again along the other and two more for the middle Shell's yes
we are hot gluing directly onto paint here but wood is fibrous and porous so
it holds pretty good I've never had an issue potions again I would say go see
episode seven but here's a quick review I use these beads from a rainbow
assortment that I got from Michael's here's the exact product and for the
bottle tops I use these 6 OE type Toho beads again here is the exact product
just attach the two together with a small dab of hot glue some people use
pins to connect them and/or use different types of glues certainly
doesn't hurt will look better but hot glue is instant I don't have to wait and
I've never had an issue with the two separating from each other you will want
to use needle nose pliers to help set that tiny bead though again got to thank
DM Brad for this potion technique check out his youtube channel
devious Dungeons painting about a brewing table two wooden planks
again two inches long and then two shorter planks chopped and hot glued to
hold it all together like you see here behold the humble paperclip this is the
kind with a plastic coating on it giving it sort of that clear tube look
straighten it out and then going to take something like a kebab skewer or a tool
and wrap the paperclip around it leaving about a half inch in each end then take
two fairly large beads and this part has to be lined quickly and they inject hot
glue into the bead and then stick one end of the paperclip into it same for
the other side and now we can hot glue those right to the tabletop some other
bits this circular bead is from my random leftovers box notice there's a
large hole in the center so I took a Swarovski crystal and hot glued it in
there and while I was at it a stray potion and another random B just for
good measure
let's do a totem very very easy just raid your crafting store be Dial for
things that catch your eye here's a big ornate looking bead hot glued to a
washer and then another colorful bead this is like I think for an anklet or a
wristlet or something like that but glue that on and then top it off with this
cool spherical bead that looks like a bunch of wires all in mesh together
enchanting table start with a one-inch washer and hot glue three planks to it
the plank should be one and a quarter inch long and then we begin to snip away
to make them into a circle so the washer X is both a mounting point and a visual
guide so that you have about an eighth of an inch overhanging all around it
if use wire cutters like I am here make sure that the flush cut side is turned
inward here's a wooden bit that can be found in most any crafting store or at
least something like it simply hot glue the top to it and paint it up like wood
or however you like then some plain old white PVA glue Elmer's painting a symbol
on the tabletop and applying glitter the finer the glitter the better it'll
Sparkle nicely I also went through my crystals again and found a matching
color because why not lastly let's do a reagent bin then this
is like the supplies used to make a potion start with a jumbo popsicle stick
don't need to paint it since you'll never see it chop it to two and a
quarter inch long attach two planks along the sides note that I apply the
hot glue to the plank and attach it like next to the base as opposed to on top of
it then two short planks at the end and these should contact the ends of all
three pieces and finally two more short planks in the middle to create three
partitions for those last two you'll need to snip them lengthwise a bit to
trim off some of the height then fill the partitions halfway with hot glue and
using some beads washers whatever you like create the legs for the bin
here I'm using those arcane big beads again with some washers and finally coat
the hot glue with white PVA and apply three different colors of glitter
I chose gold silver and diamond since this is an out in the shop after all a
piece of scotch tape over the adjacent bin will help ensure that no stray
glitter gets in while you're pouring okay so here's two of everything there's
the set we made in the live stream and the set that we just made now and again
congratulations to mr. bunch the raffle winner I hope to do that again in the
future with with live streams hope you guys enjoyed this for all you 3d
printers out there don't forget to check out heroes hoard where you can get true
tiles models as well as a ton of other excellent fantasy related scenery I am
why lock thank you for joining me and I'll see you next time
